results.title: Baby story
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s animated comic version of life in the womb. Illustrates the struggle of the sperm to fertilise the ovum when opposed by contraceptives.

results.title: Baby meets his parents
results.creator_credit: Lawrence K Frank and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality Development”.
Illustrates the concept that the baby is introduced to the world about him through parental provision for his biological needs. Three of the environmental factors influencing development are illustrated; the need for food, the need for unrestrained, normal elimination of body wastes and the need for protective care and love to foster feelings of security.

results.title: Baby in arms
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
Shows the first three months of a baby’s life as the infant interacts with its mother and other members of the family. Emphasizes the baby’s need for love and stimulation, and illustrates the ways in which a baby perceives, responds and communicates its needs to those around it. Suitable for mid-upper Secondary students.

results.title: Baby girl
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chrissy Ponting
results.brief_description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.

results.title: Baby Driver
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: Doc forces Baby, a former getaway driver, to partake in a heist, threatening to hurt his girlfriend if he refuses. The plan goes awry when their arms dealers turn out to be undercover officers.

constellations_other.name: Power and infamy
constellations_other.description: Beginning with an anamorphic image of Napoleon III, this Constellation focuses on representations of the distorted perspective of patriarchal power.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
results.description: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail.
description_for_label: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver finds himself taking part in a heist doomed to fail.

results.title: Baby crazy
results.brief_description: Being a parent is one of humanity’s most demanding and rewarding experiences - a mixture of infatuation, mad passion, fear, fun, guilt and enduring love. This amusing documentary looks at four young couples who share their intimate experiences of parenting by providing privileged access to rare moments on home video recordings and interviews. It’s a fascinating story of how a family grows and changes. “Baby Crazy” is narrated by well known actress Noni Hazelhurst, and is almost required viewing for soon to be parents, baby watchers, and baby lovers. It shows all the sensual, tender, crazy and fun-filled aspects of babyhood along with the pain and not so fun-filled aspects of having a child. Inspired by the book “Baby Crazy” by Helen Townsend.

results.title: Baby care: feeding
results.creator_credit: Paul H Seilzinger, Irving C. Boerlin and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.brief_description: The steps necessary when prepapring to feed an infant are dealt with in detail, with stress on the importance of cleanliness and exactness. (Deals mainly with artificial feeding).
